values.description:
The tutorial known as `haptix_unboxing` was very confusing. I rewrote most of it so that the target audience is now users who want to replicate the hardware and software environment we provided to the HAPTIX teams. Hopefully it is less confusing now.

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=haptix_unboxing&cat=haptix&branch=unboxing_tweaks

values.description:
I updated the installation tutorial, with two main changes:

* point Windows users to the directory containing the SDK .zip files, rather than directly to a particular `latest` file; and
* update/correct the version information and provide a compatibility table (well, a list, because I couldn't get a table to render reasonably).

To preview:

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=haptix_install&cat=haptix&branch=haptix_install_versions#Linux
values.title: Update installation tutorial

values.description:
http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=haptix_sim_api&branch=haptix_sim_api

Matlab-centric overview of the Sim API for the next HAPTIX release.

currently references some code in [haptix-comm PR 76](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/haptix-comm/pull-request/76), I'll change the links to default once the PR gets merged.

The example won't work unless you are running branch `update_hxs_example` in `haptix-comm`, which is the branch for [haptix-comm PR 76](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/haptix-comm/pull-request/76).

values.description:
[This](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/8865/gazebo_clienthh-not-found/?answer=8870#post-id-8870) question pointed out a problem with file versioning in tutorials. This pull request should fix the references for that specific tutorial, but I'm sure there must be similar problems in other tutorials.

The diff looks big but all that was done was:

1. Rename `tutorial.md` to `tutorial_1-9.md`, since that was the version it represented

2. Copied `tutorial_2-2.md` to `tutorial.md` since that seemed to reflect the most updated version

3. Changed `default` to `gazebo_2.2` in the bitbucket links for `tutorial_2-2.md`.

I think the solution here is not ideal because the gazebo6+ tutorial still points to default. We should make sure to update these links once gazebo6 is released.

Another thing I noticed is that tutorials automatically open at the most recent version, in this case, it will open at gazebo6, which is not ideal for users.
values.title: Fixed branch of bitbucket links on a specific tutorial

summary.raw:
[This](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/8865/gazebo_clienthh-not-found/?answer=8870#post-id-8870) question pointed out a problem with file versioning in tutorials. This pull request should fix the references for that specific tutorial, but I'm sure there must be similar problems in other tutorials.

The diff looks big but all that was done was:

1. Rename `tutorial.md` to `tutorial_1-9.md`, since that was the version it represented

2. Copied `tutorial_2-2.md` to `tutorial.md` since that seemed to reflect the most updated version

3. Changed `default` to `gazebo_2.2` in the bitbucket links for `tutorial_2-2.md`.

I think the solution here is not ideal because the gazebo6+ tutorial still points to default. We should make sure to update these links once gazebo6 is released.

Another thing I noticed is that tutorials automatically open at the most recent version, in this case, it will open at gazebo6, which is not ideal for users.
summary.html:
This question pointed out a problem with file versioning in tutorials. This pull request should fix the references for that specific tutorial, but I'm sure there must be similar problems in other tutorials.

The diff looks big but all that was done was:

  1. Rename tutorial.md to tutorial_1-9.md, since that was the version it represented

  2. Copied tutorial_2-2.md to tutorial.md since that seemed to reflect the most updated version

  3. Changed default to gazebo_2.2 in the bitbucket links for tutorial_2-2.md.

I think the solution here is not ideal because the gazebo6+ tutorial still points to default. We should make sure to update these links once gazebo6 is released.

Another thing I noticed is that tutorials automatically open at the most recent version, in this case, it will open at gazebo6, which is not ideal for users.

values.description:
This adds a section to the `install_from_source` tutorial about how to build gazebo in a catkin workspace. This allows multiple gazebo workspaces to be maintained side-by-side and also to optionally build against custom versions of dependencies (`ignition-math`, `sdformat`, `bullet`, etc).

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_from_source&cat=install&branch=install_catkin_workspace#Installinacatkinworkspace
values.title: Build Gazebo using catkin

values.description:
At first I was going to make a tutorial for gazebo7, but it might be useless to have it before having the branch, so I made this a tutorial about installing `default` instead. I think it might be useful to have instructions to compile default both for the core developers and for new users, so every time we change dependencies we'd update this tutorial and so on. Thanks @_jrivero_ for all the feedback. 

I copied the latest tutorial, which is for gazebo 4.0, and changed a few things:

* gazebo 4.0 to default

* sdf 2.0 to default

* DART 4.2 to 5.0

* Removed Precise

* On the 4.0 tutorial, fixed catkin version to 4.0. Didn't change any dependencies though.

* Dependencies are now taken from our release repo rather than having all listed in the tutorial.

* Didn't add the new tutorial to manifest because it would be the one showing by default on the install instructions, and I think that's not what we want, right? 

**If you know the correct versions for dependencies and other things I don't know, please update the pull request. Thanks!**
values.title: Install from source instructions for default

summary.raw:
At first I was going to make a tutorial for gazebo7, but it might be useless to have it before having the branch, so I made this a tutorial about installing `default` instead. I think it might be useful to have instructions to compile default both for the core developers and for new users, so every time we change dependencies we'd update this tutorial and so on. Thanks @_jrivero_ for all the feedback. 

I copied the latest tutorial, which is for gazebo 4.0, and changed a few things:

* gazebo 4.0 to default

* sdf 2.0 to default

* DART 4.2 to 5.0

* Removed Precise

* On the 4.0 tutorial, fixed catkin version to 4.0. Didn't change any dependencies though.

* Dependencies are now taken from our release repo rather than having all listed in the tutorial.

* Didn't add the new tutorial to manifest because it would be the one showing by default on the install instructions, and I think that's not what we want, right? 

**If you know the correct versions for dependencies and other things I don't know, please update the pull request. Thanks!**
summary.html:
At first I was going to make a tutorial for gazebo7, but it might be useless to have it before having the branch, so I made this a tutorial about installing default instead. I think it might be useful to have instructions to compile default both for the core developers and for new users, so every time we change dependencies we'd update this tutorial and so on. Thanks @jrivero for all the feedback.

I copied the latest tutorial, which is for gazebo 4.0, and changed a few things:

  • gazebo 4.0 to default

  • sdf 2.0 to default

  • DART 4.2 to 5.0

  • Removed Precise

  • On the 4.0 tutorial, fixed catkin version to 4.0. Didn't change any dependencies though.

  • Dependencies are now taken from our release repo rather than having all listed in the tutorial.

  • Didn't add the new tutorial to manifest because it would be the one showing by default on the install instructions, and I think that's not what we want, right?

If you know the correct versions for dependencies and other things I don't know, please update the pull request. Thanks!

values.description:
I copied the existing tutorial and renamed to have a version for `gazebo6`, which is important since the `CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS` must be modified in the example `CMakeLists.txt` or the plugins will not compile. I added a note about this in a0fb517 and 976cdb4.

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=plugins_hello_world&cat=write_plugin&branch=hello_world5
values.title: Update hello world plugin tutorial for gazebo6

values.description:
We are planning to use an online collaborative spreadsheet for the next gazebo tutorial review. This PR introduces a script for parsing the manifest.xml and printing info about the tutorials in each category as tab-separated values. It has some default column headers, creates links to the relevant tutorial, and creates 3 rows for each tutorial.

Here's a snippet of its output (prints to std_out):

~~~
Installation
Tutorial name	Assigned to	Issues	Solution	Approved?	OS / Build type
=HYPERLINK("http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_ubuntu&cat=install","install_ubuntu")
=HYPERLINK("http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_ubuntu&cat=install","install_ubuntu")
=HYPERLINK("http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_ubuntu&cat=install","install_ubuntu")
=HYPERLINK("http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_other_linux&cat=install","install_other_linux")
=HYPERLINK("http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_other_linux&cat=install","install_other_linux")
=HYPERLINK("http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_other_linux&cat=install","install_other_linux")
=HYPERLINK("http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_on_mac&cat=install","install_on_mac")
~~~
values.title: Add ruby script to convert manifest.xml to tsv for tutorial party spreadsheets

This PR introduces a script for parsing the manifest.xml and printing info about the tutorials in each category as tab-separated values. It has some default column headers, creates links to the relevant tutorial, and creates 3 rows for each tutorial.

Here's a snippet of its output (prints to std_out):

This PR introduces a script for parsing the manifest.xml and printing info about the tutorials in each category as tab-separated values. It has some default column headers, creates links to the relevant tutorial, and creates 3 rows for each tutorial.

Here's a snippet of its output (prints to std_out):

Installation

values.description:
* Needs [this](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1871/fix-gui-plugin-tutorials-on-gazebo5/diff) gazebo pull request. Then the tutorial should work for gazebo5 and gazebo6.

* Change links to refer to `gazebo5` instead of `default`, so changes to default don't break tutorials.

* Also made some other minor style changes


http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=gui_overlay&cat=user_input&branch=gz6_gui_overlay
values.title: GUI Overlay plugins for Gazebo5/6

summary.raw:
* Needs [this](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1871/fix-gui-plugin-tutorials-on-gazebo5/diff) gazebo pull request. Then the tutorial should work for gazebo5 and gazebo6.

* Change links to refer to `gazebo5` instead of `default`, so changes to default don't break tutorials.

* Also made some other minor style changes


http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=gui_overlay&cat=user_input&branch=gz6_gui_overlay
summary.html:
• Needs this gazebo pull request. Then the tutorial should work for gazebo5 and gazebo6.

  • Change links to refer to gazebo5 instead of default, so changes to default don't break tutorials.

  • Also made some other minor style changes

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=gui_overlay&cat=user_input&branch=gz6_gui_overlay
